creator: ian@iay.org.uk
text:
The /etc/tomcat4/tomcat4.conf file installed by default includes the following:

# Source Java system configuration if exist
if [ -x /etc/java.conf ]; then
. /etc/java.conf
fi

This requires that the new configuration file /etc/java.conf must be EXECUTABLE 
in order to be processed, which I think is an un-necessary (and as far as I can 
see, undocumented) restriction.  The following would be more sensible:

# Source Java system configuration if exist
if [ -e /etc/java.conf ]; then
. /etc/java.conf
fi

In other words, do what the comment says.

creator: hgomez@apache.org
text:
As of latest TOMCAT 4.1.10 rpm, the 'java' conf file should be /etc/java/java.conf.

You should also read the TOMCAT4.README.RPM which detail rpm specifics and for
instance this config file.

RPM users should ALLWAYS take a look in /usr/share/doc/prod...
